intro: Canthium glaucum subsp. frangula, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowcalf, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elongated seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
